Posts.Content: Survivortimes2 wrote: Reposting this as I have not gotten many responses from where I originally posted: Hello everyone.  I finished 10 radiation treatments last Wednesday to my right pelvis to help with pain and slight progression on two malignant lesions.  The day AFTER my last radiation, my CA-15-3 was drawn and it came back 6 points higher than it was in December before I started radiation.  The last time I had radiation to a bone area after a slight increase in size, my marker came down considerably.  I am wondering if it was too soon to draw the CA-15-3.  I have read that as the radiation kills the cancer cells, the dying cells are thrown into the bloodstream and this could cause an elevated reading.  Does anyone have personal experience with this happening to them??   My ONC is not concerned with the increase, but I AM.  I was so hoping for a good decline in the number from the previous reading of 70.  Instead, I was so disappointed to know it increased to 76.   Any info or personal experience will be helpful.  I am also taking Tyker, Zometa and Herceptin.
